articles.headline: In the Race for Content, Hollywood Is Buying Up Hit Podcasts
articles.snippet: “Homecoming,” “Dirty John” and “Lore” are just the first in a likely wave of headphone-to-screen adaptations.
articles.abstract: “Homecoming,” “Dirty John” and “Lore” are just the first in a likely wave of headphone-to-screen adaptations.
articles.lead_paragraph: The film mogul Darryl F. Zanuck was among the skeptics in the years before networks started broadcasting shows seven nights a week. “Television won’t be able to hold on to any market it captures after the first six months,” he infamously predicted. “People will soon get tired of staring at a plywood box every night.”

articles.headline: Big Tech May Look Troubled, but It’s Just Getting Started
articles.snippet: Even as Facebook, Google and others confronted challenges in 2018, their ambitions were undimmed. After all, so much of life remains undisrupted.
articles.abstract: Even as Facebook, Google and others confronted challenges in 2018, their ambitions were undimmed. After all, so much of life remains undisrupted.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Silicon Valley ended 2018 somewhere it had never been: embattled.
